en: You must take your coat in case it should become cold.
zh: 还是带上外套吧，万一冷了呢。

en: As long as it doesn't get cold, it's okay.
zh: 只要不冷就行。

en: The cold weather has turned the leaves red.
zh: 天冷得叶子都变红了。

en: As I felt cold, I put on my overcoat.
zh: 我觉得冷，就穿上了大衣。

en: Feeling chilly, I turned on the heater.
zh: 觉得有点冷，我就把暖气打开了。

en: I'm freezing.
zh: 冻死我了。

en: My hands are numb from the cold.
zh: 我的手都冻僵了。

en: My teeth chattered with cold.
zh: 我冷得牙齿都在打架。

en: It was cold, and, in addition, it was windy.
zh: 天挺冷的，而且还刮风。

en: I'm very sensitive to cold. May I have another blanket?
zh: 我特别怕冷。能再给我一条毯子吗？

en: It was so cold I clung to the blanket all day.
zh: 天太冷了，我整天都裹着毯子。

en: The cold weather kept us indoors.
zh: 天气太冷，我们都躲在屋里。

en: It being cold, we made a fire.
zh: 天冷，我们就生了火。

en: Though it was cold, he didn't light the fire.
zh: 虽然天冷，但他也没生火。

en: It was cold, and in addition, it was windy.
zh: 天挺冷的，而且还刮风。

en: Nobody wants to work outdoors on a cold day.
zh: 这种冷天谁都不想在室外干活。

en: It's often cold, so overcoats are advisable.
zh: 这儿经常挺冷的，最好穿大衣。

en: The cold weather continued for three weeks.
zh: 这种冷天气持续了三个星期。

en: Anticipating a cold winter, we bought a bigger stove.
zh: 觉得冬天会很冷，我们就买了个大点的炉子。

en: The cold winter will soon be over.
zh: 寒冬很快就要过去了。

en: Spring brings mild weather after the cold winter.
zh: 寒冬过后，春天暖和多了。

en: Cold winter came on.
zh: 寒冬到了。

en: When the cold winter began, the old man's health deteriorated.
zh: 入冬以后，那老人的身体越来越差了。

en: The cold weather may keep the plants from budding.
zh: 天冷可能导致植物不发芽。

en: This meat stays good in cold weather.
zh: 这肉在冷天放不坏。

en: When you breathe out in cold weather, you can see your breath.
zh: 冷天哈气的时候能看到白雾。

en: I find it hard to get up early on cold mornings.
zh: 冷天早上我很难早起。

en: It is difficult to wake up on cold mornings.
zh: 冷天早上很难睡醒。

en: It's difficult to get the car going on cold mornings.
zh: 冷天早上车很难发动。

en: In cold weather we must be sure to keep our bodies warm.
zh: 天冷一定要注意保暖。

en: Those who are delicate in health are apt to catch a cold when the cold season sets in.
zh: 身体弱的人一入冬就容易感冒。

en: Cold weather is coming.
zh: 天快变冷了。

en: The cold climate affected his health.
zh: 寒冷的天气影响了他的健康。

en: We have had a long spell of cold weather.
zh: 我们这儿冷了挺长一段时间了。

en: It's cold. It was foolish of you not to bring your coat.
zh: 天这么冷，你不带外套真是够笨的。

en: I'm cold. May I close the window?
zh: 我有点冷，能把窗户关上吗？

en: It's cold so you should wear a coat.
zh: 天冷，多穿件外套吧。

en: As it is cold, you may keep your overcoat on.
zh: 天冷，你就穿着大衣吧。

en: I wonder if they don't have meetings anymore where strong words fly and everyone goes at each other tooth and nail.
zh: 我在想，那种吵得不可开交、大家拼个你死我活的会，是不是已经没有了。

en: Bottoms up!
zh: 干杯！

en: I'm looking for batteries.
zh: 我在找电池。

en: It was all-or-nothing and we struck out spectacularly.
zh: 那是背水一战，结果我们输得很惨。

en: The dry season will set in soon.
zh: 旱季很快就要开始了。

en: Dry wood burns quickly.
zh: 干木头烧得快。

en: Dry sand absorbs water.
zh: 干沙子吸水。

en: Bring me a dry towel.
zh: 给我拿条干毛巾。

en: The Kamo runs through Kyoto.
zh: 鸭川流经京都。

en: The smell of cut grass summons up images of hot summer afternoons.
zh: 割草的味道让我回想起炎热的夏日午后。

en: When I bite down, this tooth hurts.
zh: 我这一咬牙，这颗牙就疼。

en: Kamakura is a place noted in connection with the Genji family.
zh: 镰仓是个和源氏家族大有渊源的名胜地。

en: I have lived in Kamakura for twelve years.
zh: 我在镰仓住了十二年了。

en: Air the futon.
zh: 晒晒被子吧。

en: The shareholder's meeting was held.
zh: 股东大会召开了。

en: Shareholders were concerned about the company's swift expansion overseas.
zh: 股东们挺担心公司在海外扩张得太快。

en: Shareholders voted to liquidate the company's assets.
zh: 股东们投票决定清算公司资产。

en: The stockholders are making money hand over fist.
zh: 股东们现在赚翻了。

en: Stock investments do not always yield profit.
zh: 炒股不一定都能赚钱。

en: The stock market is often called a dangerous one.
zh: 大家都说股市挺险恶的。

en: The stock market tumbled.
zh: 股市暴跌了。

en: The stock market is in a prolonged slump.
zh: 股市持续低迷。

en: The stock market was surprisingly quiet today.
zh: 今天股市静得出奇。

en: The stock market has dropped today.
zh: 今天股市跌了。

en: The stock market is very active.
zh: 股市交易非常活跃。

en: The stock market is severely depressed.
zh: 股市现在太不景气了。

en: The stock market crash forced many retirees back into the job market.
zh: 股市崩盘让好多退休的人不得不回去找工作。

en: The stock has gone down over night.
zh: 股价一夜之间就跌了。

en: You have no grounds for accusing Jill of stealing the stock certificates.
zh: 你没证据说是吉尔偷了股票凭证。

en: The stock price index was off 200 points yesterday.
zh: 昨天股指跌了200点。

en: The stock price index soared to an all-time high.
zh: 股指涨到了历史新高。

en: The price of the stock declined by half in a month.
zh: 这股价一个月里跌了一半。

en: Stock prices plunged to a record low.
zh: 股价跌到了历史最低点。

en: Stock prices declined for five consecutive days.
zh: 股价连跌了五天。

en: The price of stock declined by half in a month.
zh: 股价一个月就腰斩了。

en: There was a rapid decline in stock prices.
zh: 股价跌得挺凶的。

en: Stocks fell hard.
zh: 股票跌惨了。

en: A record number of shares changed hands in busy trading as prices soared to a historic high.
zh: 股价冲上历史新高的同时，成交量也创了纪录。

en: Stock prices dropped.
zh: 股价跌了。

en: Stocks hit a new high.
zh: 股价创新高了。

en: What a fool she is to dabble in stocks!
zh: 她去炒股真是太傻了。

en: He was a stock-market tycoon until the bears got him.
zh: 在遇到熊市之前，他还是个股市大亨。

en: I lost my shirt on the stock market.
zh: 我炒股赔了个精光。

en: It was careless of you to leave your bag.
zh: 你太粗心了，竟然把包落下了。

en: Stick the bag down under the seat.
zh: 把包塞到座位下面去。

en: Will you open the bag?
zh: 能把包打开吗？

en: You may leave your bag here.
zh: 你可以把包放这儿。

en: I need a bag. Will you lend me one?
zh: 我需要个袋子，能借我一个吗？

en: Kasai was credited with 30 saves.
zh: 葛西拿到了30次救援成功。

en: He was in the middle of a funny story when he stopped to answer the telephone.
zh: 他正讲着笑话呢，就停下来去接电话了。

en: Well begun is half done.
zh: 良好的开端是成功的一半。

en: The eagle does not catch flies.
zh: 雄鹰不捕苍蝇。

en: Activists are stepping up their protest drive.
zh: 活动分子正加大抗议力度。

en: Activity keeps the mind from rusting.
zh: 脑子多动动才不会生锈。

en: The boy was bored with home routines that were dull and unchanging.
zh: 这孩子受够了家里那些枯燥死板的琐事。

en: I think it's a good thing because it keep us on our toes.
zh: 我觉得这是好事，能让我们保持警觉。

en: The appropriation is pin-money; it wouldn't be enough even to build a gym, much less build the administration building.
zh: 这点拨款就是毛毛雨，盖个健身房都不够，更别提盖行政楼了。

en: Don't step on the broken glass.
zh: 别踩到碎玻璃。

en: You must perform all assignments in a timely manner.
zh: 你必须按时完成所有任务。

en: How much was the additional charge?
zh: 附加费是多少？

en: Don't cut in line.
zh: 别插队。

en: Let's split it.
zh: 咱们平摊吧。

en: An old oak is groaning in the storm.
zh: 暴风雨中，一棵老橡树嘎吱作响。

en: Don't buy things on credit.
zh: 买东西别赊账。

en: Hang your coat on the hook.
zh: 把外套挂在钩子上。

en: The sum came to over 20,000 yen.
zh: 总共两万多日元。

en: My forehead burned with fever.
zh: 我的额头烫得厉害。

en: Wipe the sweat from your brow.
zh: 擦擦额头上的汗。

en: Come feel my forehead.
zh: 来摸摸我的额头。

en: A high forehead is indicative of great mental power.
zh: 额头高说明人聪明。

en: The frame itself is worth more than the picture.
zh: 这框本身比画还值钱。

en: The sweat was dripping off my brow.
zh: 汗水从我的额头滴了下来。

en: The band played marvellously under the baton of a new conductor.
zh: 在新指挥的带领下，乐队演奏得棒极了。

en: The band played several marches.
zh: 乐队演奏了几首进行曲。

en: The band sprang into life.
zh: 乐队一下子活跃了起来。

en: The band paraded the streets.
zh: 乐队在街上游行演奏。

en: The band played for the visiting monarch.
zh: 乐队为来访的君主演奏。

en: A band led the parade through the city.
zh: 一支乐队领着游行队伍穿过城市。

en: It's a piece of cake.
zh: 小菜一碟。

en: Do you play a musical instrument?
zh: 你会乐器吗？

en: Some learned to play musical instruments.
zh: 有些人学会了玩乐器。

en: The optimist looks into a mirror and becomes more optimistic, the pessimist more pessimistic.
zh: 乐观的人照镜子会更乐观，悲观的人则会更悲观。

en: After a storm comes a calm.
zh: 雨过天晴。

en: Easy come, easy go.
zh: 来得快，去得也快。

en: It was easy for me to solve the problem.
zh: 我轻而易举就解决了那个问题。

en: Have fun.
zh: 玩得开心。

en: Have a nice time.
zh: 玩得愉快。

en: Have a good time.
zh: 玩得开心点。

en: Are you enjoying it?
zh: 你觉得好玩吗？

en: Time goes by quickly when you're having fun.
zh: 开心的时候，时间过得特别快。

en: Enjoy yourself!
zh: 尽情玩吧！

en: I'm looking forward to it.
zh: 我很期待。

en: Have fun, but don't get lost.
zh: 好好玩，别走丢了。

en: We enjoyed seeing the city, but we got a little tired.
zh: 我们逛这城市逛得很开心，但也有点累。

en: Did you have a good time?
zh: 你玩得开心吗？

en: Did you enjoy yourself?
zh: 你玩得尽兴吗？

en: We are having a good time.
zh: 我们现在玩得很开心。

en: Singing merrily, they started for home.
zh: 他们开心地唱着歌回家了。

en: Let's have some fun.
zh: 咱们找点乐子吧。

en: I hope you're having fun.
zh: 希望你玩得开心。

en: Are you having a good time?
zh: 你玩得愉快吗？

en: Enjoy your trip.
zh: 祝你旅途愉快。

en: I wish you a pleasant voyage.
zh: 祝你航行愉快。

en: I hope you had a nice trip.
zh: 希望你这次旅行玩得开心。

en: Thank you for the pleasant evening.
zh: 谢谢，今晚过得很愉快。

en: Sweet dreams, Timmy.
zh: 晚安好梦，提米。

en: Have a nice weekend.
zh: 周末愉快。

en: Have a nice flight.
zh: 祝你飞行愉快。

en: Did you have a good weekend?
zh: 你周末过得怎么样？

en: When you're enjoying yourself, the time seems to fly by.
zh: 玩得开心的时候，时间过得飞快。

en: A pleasant trip to you!
zh: 祝你旅途愉快！

en: Have a nice vacation.
zh: 假期愉快。

en: Let's sing a happy song.
zh: 我们唱首开心的歌吧。

en: My happy schooldays will soon be behind me.
zh: 我快乐的学生时代很快就要结束了。

en: Let's sing some merry songs.
zh: 咱们唱几首欢快的歌吧。

en: Have a nice summer vacation.
zh: 祝你暑假愉快。

en: Wishing you a Halloween filled with fun.
zh: 祝你万圣节玩得开心。

en: It's our pleasure.
zh: 这是我们的荣幸。

en: It's been nice talking to you, but I really must go now.
zh: 跟你聊得很开心，但我真的得走了。

en: She can express her feelings when she feels happy or sad.
zh: 她开心或难过的时候都能表达出自己的感受。

en: Pleasure is the source of pain.
zh: 快乐是痛苦的根源。

en: The head of the college, whose name was Miss Baker, therefore had a special place in the car park for her own small car.
zh: 学院院长贝克小姐在停车场有个停她小车的专属车位。

en: Scholarship must always be exact whether it is interesting or not.
zh: 做学问必须严谨，不管它有没有趣。

en: There is no easy road to learning.
zh: 学习没有捷径。

en: Without hesitating, the dean selects infinite wisdom.
zh: 院长毫不犹豫地选择了无穷的智慧。

en: He was at a loss as to which faculty to choose.
zh: 他不知道该选哪个院系。

en: I'll rely on my father for half of my tuition.
zh: 我的一半学费得靠我爸出。

en: The pupils burst out laughing.
zh: 学生们哄堂大笑。

en: The president addressed his students as follows.
zh: 校长向学生们发表了如下讲话。

en: The school uniform is convenient because it can be worn for both informal and formal occasions.
zh: 校服很方便，正式和非正式场合都能穿。

en: They hate him because he gives them a mountain of homework.
zh: 他们讨厌他，因为他布置的作业堆积如山。

en: The students volunteered for community service.
zh: 学生们自愿参加了社区服务。

en: The students were animated by the agitator's appeal.
zh: 煽动者的号召让学生们兴奋了起来。

en: The students sat still, listening to the lecture.
zh: 学生们静静地坐着听讲座。

en: The students demonstrated against the new government.
zh: 学生们游行示威反对新政府。

en: The students are busy preparing for the examination.
zh: 学生们正忙着准备考试。

en: The students are having a recess now.
zh: 学生们现在正在课间休息。

en: The students gathered at the call of the principal.
zh: 学生们应校长的召集聚在了一起。

en: The students noted the professor's main points.
zh: 学生们记下了教授讲的重点。

en: Students are open to the influence of their teachers.
zh: 学生很容易受老师的影响。

en: The students are making good progress in English.
zh: 学生们的英语进步很大。

en: The students cheered in honor of Dr. Baker's birthday.
zh: 学生们欢呼着庆祝贝克博士的生日。

en: The students stood waiting for a bus.
zh: 学生们站着等公交车。

en: None of the students have arrived on time.
zh: 没有一个学生准时到。

en: I don't think any more students want to come.
zh: 我觉得应该没有更多学生想来了。

en: Not all the students were present at the class.
zh: 并不是所有的学生都到场了。

en: There was no objection on the part of the students.
zh: 学生们没有提出反对意见。

en: This is a store that caters specially to students.
zh: 这是一家专门面向学生的店。

en: All the students recognized her as their representative.
zh: 所有学生都认她做代表。

en: All of the students were present.
zh: 所有学生都到齐了。

en: All the students will partake in the play.
zh: 所有学生都会参加这出戏的演出。

en: It is absurd to idle away the student life.
zh: 虚度学生时代是极其荒唐的。

en: In his school days he wasn't as gentle as he is now.
zh: 他上学那会儿可没现在这么温柔。

en: He was far from clever in his school days.
zh: 他上学的时候一点也不聪明。

en: I was keen on classical music in my school days.
zh: 我上学那会儿特别迷古典音乐。

en: I got to know him when I was a student.
zh: 我还是学生的时候认识他的。

en: It was an advantage having learned Chinese while I was in school.
zh: 上学的时候学过中文是个优势。

en: I regret having been idle in my school days.
zh: 我后悔上学的时候太虚度光阴了。

en: I used to go fishing in my school days.
zh: 我上学那会儿经常去钓鱼。

en: Read as many books as you can while you are a student.
zh: 趁着还是学生，尽量多读点书。

en: John would often go mountain climbing when he was a student.
zh: 约翰当学生那会儿经常去爬山。

en: I studied in England for six months when I was a student.
zh: 我当学生的时候在英国留学了半年。

en: His stock with the students has soared.
zh: 他在学生中的人气飙升。

en: Do you have a student fare?
zh: 你们有学生票吗？

en: The student hall is for benefit of the students.
zh: 学生中心是为学生服务的。

en: There are several restrictions on working to support yourself abroad on a student visa.
zh: 拿学生签证出国打工赚生活费有很多限制。

en: Students should develop their reading skills.
zh: 学生应该培养阅读能力。

en: Students are supposed to study hard.
zh: 学生应该努力学习。

en: Students should try not to be late.
zh: 学生应该尽量不迟到。

en: Every student has access to the library.
zh: 每个学生都能进图书馆。

en: The students are for the most part diligent.
zh: 学生们大多都很勤奋。

en: A student spends a lot of time studying.
zh: 学生花很多时间学习。

en: Students have a holiday on Foundation Day.
zh: 校庆那天学生放假。

en: Students have access to the library.
zh: 学生可以进图书馆。

en: Students should make use of the books in the library.
zh: 学生应该利用图书馆里的书。

en: Students must keep silent during a class.
zh: 课上学生必须保持安静。

en: Students should make the most of their free time.
zh: 学生应该充分利用课余时间。

en: A student should not lose sight of his own identity.
zh: 学生不应该忘了自己的身份。

en: Students are apt to waste time.
zh: 学生很容易浪费时间。

en: Students are longing for the vacation.
zh: 学生们都盼着放假。

en: Students are supposed to turn in reports at the end of the school year.
zh: 学期末学生得交报告。

en: All of the students stood up together.
zh: 所有学生都一起站了起来。

en: Each student received his diploma in turn.
zh: 每个学生依次领到了毕业证。

en: All the students protested against the war.
zh: 所有学生都抗议战争。

en: The student left without saying anything.
zh: 那个学生什么也没说就走了。

en: Students often study with music playing in the background, and people working around the house will usually turn on the television or radio to keep them company.
zh: 学生学习时经常开着背景音乐，而在家干活的人通常会开着电视或收音机来解闷。

en: Students bustled about all the night.
zh: 学生们忙活了一整晚。

en: None of the students were late for school.
zh: 没有学生上学迟到。

en: Study the student more.
zh: 要多了解了解学生。

en: The teacher as well as his students has come.
zh: 老师和学生都来了。

en: Each student has expressed his opinion.
zh: 每个学生都表达了看法。

en: All the students shouted with joy.
zh: 所有学生都高兴地叫了起来。

en: Every student has free access to the library.
zh: 每个学生都能免费进图书馆。

en: All the students attended the party.
zh: 所有学生都参加了派对。

en: All the students come from the US.
zh: 所有学生都来自美国。

en: The students have an excellent gym at their disposal.
zh: 学生们有个挺棒的健身房可以用。

en: Students often pursue their teacher with questions.
zh: 学生经常追着老师问问题。

en: Students will take one of these English courses.
zh: 学生会从这些英语课里选一门。

en: Students have access to these computers.
zh: 学生可以使用这些电脑。

en: Students generally like a teacher who understands their problems.
zh: 学生通常喜欢能理解他们的老师。

en: Half of the students are absent.
zh: 有一半的学生没来。

en: Half the students were absent.
zh: 有一半学生缺席。

en: The students' lunch period is from twelve to one.
zh: 学生午餐时间是十二点到一点。

en: Some of the students come to school by car.
zh: 有些学生开车上学。

en: Some of the students like to play the guitar.
zh: 有些学生喜欢弹吉他。

en: A majority of students dislike history.
zh: 大多数学生都不喜欢历史。

en: Not all the students are against the plan.
zh: 并不是所有学生都反对这个计划。

en: The number of students is decreasing year by year.
zh: 学生人数一年比一年少。

en: I was used to studying when I was a student.
zh: 我以前当学生那会儿习惯了学习。

en: Being only a student, I can't afford to get married.
zh: 我只是个学生，结不起婚。

en: I used to play tennis when I was a student.
zh: 我当学生的时候经常打网球。

en: Some of the students were from Asia and the others were from Europe.
zh: 那些学生里有些来自亚洲，剩下的来自欧洲。

en: Almost all the students like English.
zh: 几乎所有的学生都喜欢英语。

en: One student says the purge is still going on in China and terror is widespread.
zh: 有个学生说中国还在搞清洗，到处都人心惶惶。

en: I often wrote to her when I was a student.
zh: 我当学生那会儿经常给她写信。

en: Memories of my college days come to my mind.
zh: 我脑子里浮现出大学时代的那些回忆。

en: Two-thirds of the students came to the meeting.
zh: 三分之二的学生都来开会了。

en: I asked the student what image he had of black people.
zh: 我问那个学生，他对黑人是什么印象。

en: Admission to students only.
zh: 仅限学生。

en: Have students read such books as will make them think more.
zh: 多让学生读读那些能启发思考的书。

en: Do you take in students?
zh: 你这儿收学生吗？

en: You had better leave the students to find out for themselves.
zh: 你最好让学生们自己去发现。

en: If you are a student, behave as such.
zh: 既然你是学生，就得有个学生样。

en: Students are expected to stay away from dubious places.
zh: 学生不该去那些不三不四的地方。

en: The students chose her chairman.
zh: 学生们选她当主席。

en: His students adored him.
zh: 他的学生都很崇拜他。

en: Students discussed the problem of brain death for a long time.
zh: 学生们就脑死亡的问题讨论了很久。

en: The students learned many poems by heart.
zh: 学生们背了很多诗。

en: The students noted down every word the teacher said.
zh: 学生们把老师说的每个字都记下来了。

en: The students grimaced at the teacher.
zh: 学生们对着老师做鬼脸。

en: Students have been protesting against the government's decision.
zh: 学生们一直在抗议政府的决定。

en: The students sat still all the time.
zh: 学生们一直静静地坐着。

en: Students came of their own accord to help the villagers.
zh: 学生们自发地来帮村民们的忙。

en: The students were ill at ease before the exam.
zh: 考试前学生们都很心神不宁。

en: The students wanted us to help push the car.
zh: 学生们想让我们帮忙推下车。

en: The students revolted against authority.
zh: 学生们反抗权威。

en: The students assisted the professor in the investigation.
zh: 学生们协助教授进行调查。

en: The students assembled in the classroom.
zh: 学生们在教室集合了。

en: The students turned in their term papers.
zh: 学生们交了期末论文。

en: Each of the students has to attend the morning.
zh: 每个学生都得参加晨会。

en: Students are impatient for the summer holidays to come.
zh: 学生们都急着盼暑假快点到。

en: The students discussed the plan for many hours.
zh: 学生们讨论那个计划讨论了好几个小时。

en: Each of the students has his own shoes.
zh: 每个学生都有自己的鞋。

en: Each of the students has his own locker.
zh: 每个学生都有自己的储物柜。

en: The students were all looking forward to the summer vacation.
zh: 学生们都特别期待暑假。

en: Some of the students went by bus, and others on foot.
zh: 有的学生坐公交去，有的走路去。

en: The students met here to hear the speech.
zh: 学生们在这里集合听演讲。

en: Students often find it very difficult to understand a lecture in a foreign language.
zh: 学生们经常觉得听外语讲座特别费劲。

en: The students have taken no notice of these instructions.
zh: 学生们根本没理会这些规定。

en: The students learned this poem by heart.
zh: 学生们背下了这首诗。

en: The students performed Hamlet.
zh: 学生们演了《哈姆雷特》。

en: The students were required to learn the Constitution by heart.
zh: 学生们被要求背下宪法。

en: Students took the lead in the campaign against pollution.
zh: 学生们在反污染运动中带了头。

en: There were hardly any teachers at the school that students could talk to.
zh: 学校里几乎没几个能跟学生聊得来的老师。

en: The student center is a good place to strike up conversations.
zh: 学生中心是个找人搭话的好地方。

en: I'll bet he'd have a fit if his students fell asleep.
zh: 我敢打赌，要是他的学生睡着了，他肯定得气炸了。

en: It is taken for granted that students know how to express themselves.
zh: 大家都觉得学生理所当然应该知道怎么表达自己。

en: A student visited the house of the great playwright.
zh: 有个学生去那位伟大的剧作家家里拜访了。

en: A student wants to see you.
zh: 有个学生想见你。

en: Three students. Here's my student ID.
zh: 三个学生。这是我的学生证。

en: I am tired of eating at the school cafeteria.
zh: 我吃腻了学校食堂。

en: You should avail yourself of every opportunity to learn.
zh: 你应该利用好每一个学习的机会。

en: He is something of a scholar.
zh: 他也算是个学者。

en: There is no easy process of learning.
zh: 学习没什么捷径。

en: Some scholars ascribe the settlement of America to social unrest in Western Europe.
zh: 有些学者认为移民美洲是因为西欧的社会动荡。

en: According to some scholars, a major earthquake could occur at any moment now.
zh: 据一些学者说，大地震随时可能发生。

en: Scholarly as he is, he can't be relied on.
zh: 虽说他很有学问，但这人靠不住。

en: A man of learning is not always a man of sense.
zh: 有学问的人不一定有常识。

en: He is proud of his scholarship.
zh: 他挺以自己的学识为荣的。

en: In terms of learning, he is superior to all of his friends.
zh: 论学问，他比他所有的朋友都强。

en: Learning is one thing, and common sense another.
zh: 有学问是一回事，有常识是另一回事。

en: He was very learned, but he didn't know it.
zh: 他博学多才，但他自己却没意识到。

en: It should be clear that the curriculum reform is mandatory in order to enhance interdisciplinary research.
zh: 很明显，为了加强跨学科研究，课程改革是必须的。

en: Our school administration decided to do away with that school rule.
zh: 学校决定废除那条校规。

en: My time in school will be one of my happiest memories.
zh: 校园时光会成为我最美好的回忆之一。

en: School systems have to cope with changing numbers of pupils.
zh: 学校系统得应对学生人数的变化。

en: I usually went to bed at ten in my school days.
zh: 我上学那会儿通常十点睡觉。

en: He was very happy in his school days.
zh: 他上学那会儿过得挺开心的。

en: I would often take part in an English speech contest in my school days.
zh: 我上学那会儿经常参加英语演讲比赛。

en: He ended up expelled.
zh: 他最后被开除了。

en: On leaving school, he went to Africa.
zh: 毕业后，他就去非洲了。

en: I graduated from the school.
zh: 我从那所学校毕业了。

en: On leaving school, he went into business.
zh: 毕业后，他去经商了。

en: On leaving school, she got married to her classmate.
zh: 毕业后，她就跟同学结婚了。

en: What are you going to do after you leave school?
zh: 你毕业后打算干嘛？

en: I will have to wait till I finish schooling and start earning money.
zh: 我得等到毕业开始挣钱了才行。

en: What a fool he is to leave school.
zh: 他居然退学，真是个傻瓜。

en: The cost of operating schools continued to rise.
zh: 办学成本一直在涨。

en: Outside the school, she saw people with no homes living in cardboard boxes.
zh: 学校外面，她看到无家可归的人住在纸板箱里。

en: As soon as he graduated, he went to work in his father's general store.
zh: 他一毕业就去他爸的杂货铺上班了。

en: Let's skip school and go see the movie.
zh: 咱们逃学去看电影吧。

en: Cutting school is the first stage of delinquency.
zh: 逃学是变坏的第一步。

en: I like summer holidays better than school.
zh: 比起上学，我更喜欢放暑假。

en: Will you walk down to the school with me?
zh: 你能陪我走去学校吗？

en: The school is only a five-minute walk.
zh: 走去学校只要五分钟。

en: I can walk to school in half an hour.
zh: 我走去学校要半个小时。

en: I ran to school, but the bell had already rung.
zh: 我跑着去学校，但铃已经响了。

en: A man who has never gone to school may steal from a freight car, but if he has a university education, he may steal the whole railroad.
zh: 没上过学的人可能会偷货车里的东西，但受过大学教育的人可能会偷走整条铁路。

en: The street to school was flooded and we had to go around.
zh: 去学校的路被淹了，我们得绕道。

en: Remember to post the letter on your way to school.
zh: 去学校路上记得把信寄了。

en: Don't forget to mail this letter on your way to school.
zh: 去学校路上别忘了寄这封信。

en: I met her on my way to school.
zh: 我在去学校的路上碰到她了。

en: While crossing the street on my way to school, I met with an accident.
zh: 我去学校过马路的时候出了点意外。

en: I met Tom on my way to school.
zh: 我在去学校的路上碰到了汤姆。

en: Wash your face before you go to school.
zh: 上学前先洗脸。

en: He was going to school.
zh: 他当时正要去上学。

en: Go to school.
zh: 去上学吧。

en: Can you walk to school, or do you have to take the bus?
zh: 你能走着去学校吗，还是得坐公交？

en: It takes us half an hour to walk to school.
zh: 我们走去学校要半小时。

en: It's a shortcut to the school.
zh: 这是去学校的捷径。

en: Schools were started to help young people prepare for living in the world.
zh: 办学校是为了帮年轻人为步入社会做好准备。

en: School begins tomorrow.
zh: 明天开学。

en: School begins the day after tomorrow.
zh: 后天开学。

en: Schools are expected to meet the needs of every child, regardless of ability.
zh: 学校应该满足每个孩子的需求，不论能力如何。

en: Our school begins at eight in the morning.
zh: 我们学校早上八点上课。

en: Is the school on this side of the river?
zh: 学校在河的这一边吗？

en: The school adopted the new method of teaching English.
zh: 学校采用了新的英语教学法。

en: Our school was reduced to ashes.
zh: 我们学校被烧成灰了。

en: School begins in spring.
zh: 春天开学。

en: They announced an increase in tuition fees.
zh: 他们宣布要涨学费。

en: The school is within walking distance of my house.
zh: 学校离我家走路就能到。

en: School begins on April the tenth.
zh: 四月十号开学。

en: School begins in April.
zh: 四月开学。

en: School starts next Monday.
zh: 下周一开学。

en: School begins at 8:10 a.m.
zh: 早上八点十分上课。

en: The school is situated in healthy surroundings.
zh: 学校周围的环境非常不错。

en: School will open on Monday.
zh: 周一开学。

en: School begins at nine.
zh: 九点上课。

en: School reopens in September.
zh: 九月开学。

en: You shouldn't go to school.
zh: 你不该去学校。

en: Our school is within ten minutes' walk of my house.
zh: 我们学校离我家走路不到十分钟。

en: Is your school far from your home?
zh: 你学校离家远吗？

en: What time does school begin?
zh: 几点上课？

en: School will break for the summer.
zh: 学校要放暑假了。

en: The school is farther than the station.
zh: 学校比车站还要远。

en: The school is located within five minutes' walk of the station.
zh: 学校离车站走路也就五分钟。

en: The school awarded Mary a prize.
zh: 学校给玛丽发了奖。

en: School will soon break up for the summer vacation.
zh: 学校马上就要放暑假了。

en: The school drains the pool once a month.
zh: 学校每个月清理一次泳池。

en: Where do you go to school?
zh: 你在哪儿上学？

en: The school is only five minutes' walk from here.
zh: 学校从这儿走过去只要五分钟。

en: School has closed for the Christmas holidays.
zh: 学校放圣诞假了。

en: The school stands about one mile off.
zh: 学校大约在一英里外。

en: The school is across from our house.
zh: 学校就在我家对面。

en: When is school over?
zh: 什么时候放学？

en: When does your school break up?
zh: 你们学校什么时候放假？

en: When does school break up?
zh: 什么时候放假？

en: Does school start at eight-thirty?
zh: 是八点半上课吗？

en: School begins at nine and is over at six.
zh: 九点上课，六点放学。

en: School begins at eight-thirty.
zh: 八点半上课。

en: Our school begins at eight.
zh: 我们学校八点上课。

en: The school is two kilometers ahead.
zh: 学校就在前面两公里处。

en: School begins on April 8.
zh: 四月八号开学。

en: He excels all his brothers in scholastic ability.
zh: 他的学习能力比他所有兄弟都强。

en: The school grounds extend as far as this fence.
zh: 学校操场一直延伸到这个围栏。

en: The school gymnasium was enlarged.
zh: 学校体育馆扩建了。

en: Don't tell tales out of school.
zh: 别在外面乱传学校里的事。

en: We celebrated the centenary anniversary day.
zh: 我们庆祝了百周年校庆。

en: You see some trees in front of the school.
zh: 学校前面有一些树。

en: School children have colds twice as often as adults.
zh: 学生感冒的次数是成年人的两倍。

en: My school grades were average.
zh: 我的成绩很一般。

en: A poor school record will count against you when you look for a job.
zh: 成绩不好对你找工作不利。

en: You could also say that he's at the bottom of the class, for sure.
zh: 你完全可以说他绝对是班里垫底的。

en: School uniforms are just out of fashion.
zh: 校服早就过时了。

en: The closing of school was due to the snow.
zh: 因为下雪，学校停课了。

en: You must follow school rules.
zh: 你得遵守学校的规矩。

en: I do a lot of work on the school newspaper.
zh: 我在校报干了不少活。

en: There is a bus stop near our school.
zh: 我们学校附近有个公交车站。

en: Living near the school, I usually walk there.
zh: 我住得离学校近，一般都走路去。

en: School discipline is not as it should be.
zh: 学校纪律不怎么样。

en: I called at Nancy's house on my way home from school.
zh: 我放学回家的路上顺便去了趟南希家。

en: We went on a school trip to Nara.
zh: 我们学校组织去奈良旅游了。

en: We went to Lake Towada on a school excursion.
zh: 我们学校组织去十和田湖远足了。

en: I heard the school bell ring.
zh: 我听到学校铃声响了。

en: Though he lives within a stone's throw of the school, he is often late.
zh: 虽然他家离学校就几步路，但他还是经常迟到。

en: I'm going to join the school orchestra.
zh: 我要参加学校的乐团。

en: When the school had no books or paper or pencils, she wrote the alphabet on the ground with a stick.
zh: 学校没书没纸没铅笔的时候，她就拿木棍在地上写字母。

en: It's up to you to get to school on time.
zh: 能不能按时到校就看你自己的了。

en: Arriving at school, I found the race was over.
zh: 我一到学校，发现比赛已经结束了。

en: I cared for the rabbits when I was at school.
zh: 我在学校的时候负责照顾那些兔子。

en: Don't be late for school.
zh: 上学别迟到。

en: You must not be late for school.
zh: 你上学绝对不能迟到。

en: The number of students who were late for school was much smaller than I had expected.
zh: 迟到的学生人数比我想象的少得多。

en: Some of the students were late for school.
zh: 有些学生上学迟到了。

en: I'm afraid we're going to be late for school.
zh: 我看我们要上学迟到了。

en: Your contribution to the school is tax-deductible.
zh: 你给学校的捐助是可以免税的。

en: I lost my purse on my way to school.
zh: 我上学路上把钱包丢了。

en: John met Mary on his way to school.
zh: 约翰在去学校的路上碰到了玛丽。

en: While I was going to school, I was caught in a shower.
zh: 我去学校的路上遇到了阵雨。

en: What is the principle reason for going to school?
zh: 上学的主要目的是什么？

en: It's time to go to school.
zh: 该去上学了。

en: I put on a cap when I go to school.
zh: 我上学的时候会戴帽子。

en: Instead of going to school, he stayed at home.
zh: 他没去上学，而是待在家里。

en: You are not going to make it in time for school.
zh: 你上学要赶不及了。

en: I live within walking distance of school.
zh: 我住的地方离学校走着就能到。

en: Why are you here when you should be in school?
zh: 你这时候应该在学校，怎么会在这儿？

en: Would you mail this letter for me on your way to school?
zh: 你上学路上能不能顺便帮我把这封信寄了？

en: If you are to do well in school, you must study hard.
zh: 如果你想在学校表现出色，就得刻苦学习。

en: Teaching spontaneous thinking is difficult in schools.
zh: 在学校里教自主思考挺难的。

en: How often do you study English at school?
zh: 你们在学校多久学一次英语？

en: Remember well what you learn at school.
zh: 要把在学校学到的东西记牢。

en: The school is crying out for good teachers.
zh: 学校急需优秀的老师。

en: You are not supposed to smoke at school.
zh: 在学校里是不准抽烟的。

en: At school he was always at the top of his class.
zh: 他在学校的时候成绩一直是班里顶尖的。

en: At school I am on the Newspaper Committee.
zh: 我在学校是报社委员会的成员。

en: My school is getting ready for the campus music festival.
zh: 我们学校正在为校园音乐节做准备。

en: What subjects do you study at school?
zh: 你在学校都学什么科目？

en: Schools have tried to limit their use by not allowing them to be used in math classes, although they allow them in science lessons to save time.
zh: 虽然科学课为了省时间允许使用，但学校为了限制使用，在数学课上是不让用的。

en: This was third school shooting incident in six months.
zh: 这是半年里发生的第三起校园枪击案。

en: I wanted to have finished it by the time school was over.
zh: 我本来想在放学之前把它做完的。

en: Success in school calls for much hard study.
zh: 要在学校表现优异，得付出很多努力才行。

en: School being over, we went home.
zh: 放学后，我们就回家了。

en: I am very glad school is over.
zh: 放学了，我好开心。

en: School being over, we went swimming in the pool.
zh: 放学以后，我们去游泳池游泳了。

en: You must be hungry after school is over.
zh: 放学了你肯定饿了吧。

en: The school provided us with textbooks.
zh: 学校给我们发了课本。

en: The month when school begins is April.
zh: 学校是在四月份开学的。

en: School has started and I like it so far.
zh: 开学了，目前感觉还挺不错的。

en: The school will provide tents for us.
zh: 学校会给我们提供帐篷。

en: Some go in groups organized by their schools, but most go in twos and threes.
zh: 有的是参加学校组织的团去的，但大多数人都是三三两两去的。

en: On my way home from school, I was caught in a shower and got wet to the skin.
zh: 放学回家的路上遇到了阵雨，淋得我浑身湿透。

en: When she returned home from school, she began to help her mother in the kitchen.
zh: 她放学回到家，就开始在厨房帮她妈妈忙。

en: I have just come back from school.
zh: 我刚放学回来。

en: I was caught in a shower on my way home from school.
zh: 我放学回家的路上遇到阵雨了。

en: I was caught in a shower on my way home from school, got soaking wet and caught a cold.
zh: 我放学回家的路上淋了场雨，浑身湿透，还感冒了。

en: When she saw that they had no schools, she started one.
zh: 她看到他们那儿没学校，就自己办了一所。

en: I was also impressed with the school's cleanliness and the students' pride in it.
zh: 学校很整洁，学生们也以此为荣，这让我印象深刻。

en: School is where we spend most of our time every day.
zh: 学校是我们每天待的时间最长的地方。

en: Success in school calls for hard study.
zh: 要在学校表现好，就得刻苦学习。

en: It is silly of you to neglect your studies.
zh: 你居然荒废学业，太傻了。

en: The final exams are approaching.
zh: 期末考试快到了。

en: They helped one another to make the school festival a success.
zh: 他们互相帮忙，让校庆办得很成功。

en: Our campus festival is to be held next week.
zh: 我们的校园文化节下周举行。

en: Learning without thought is labor lost.
zh: 光学习不思考是白费劲。

en: The more you learn, the more you want to.
zh: 越学越想学。

en: The more we learn, the better we realize our ignorance.
zh: 学得越多，越发现自己无知。

en: The more you study, the more you discover your ignorance.
zh: 越学习，就越发现自己懂的太少。

en: The more we learn, the more we realize how little we know.
zh: 学得越多，越发现自己知道的是多么有限。

en: You're never too old to learn.
zh: 活到老，学到老。

en: One is never too old to learn.
zh: 活到老，学到老。

en: No one is too old to learn.
zh: 活到老，学到老。

en: The man who stops learning is as good as dead.
zh: 人停止了学习，就跟死了一样。

en: The learned are apt to despise the ignorant.
zh: 有学问的人往往容易瞧不起没文化的人。

en: The revolutionary council met to plan strategy.
zh: 革命委员会开会讨论战略。

en: After the revolution, France became a republic.
zh: 革命后，法国成了共和国。

en: The revolution brought in a new era.
zh: 这场革命开启了一个新时代。

en: The revolution has brought about many changes.
zh: 革命带来了很多变化。

en: Every member of the cabinet was present.
zh: 内阁成员全都出席了。

en: I'd like a room in the corner of the building.
zh: 我想要一间在这栋楼拐角处的房间。

en: One lump of sugar, please.
zh: 请给我一块方糖。

en: Please put a lump of sugar in my coffee.
zh: 请往我咖啡里放一块方糖。

en: As we went around the corner, the lake came in sight.
zh: 我们拐过弯，湖泊就映入眼帘了。

en: Round the corner came a large truck.
zh: 拐角处开过来一辆大卡车。

en: You'll find the shop around the corner.
zh: 商店就在转弯处。

en: There is a bookstore just 'round the corner.
zh: 拐角那儿就有一家书店。

en: Will you run down to the corner and buy me a paper?
zh: 你能跑去街角帮我买份报纸吗？

en: There's a pub just around the corner.
zh: 拐角那儿就有一家酒馆。

en: The house on the corner is ours.
zh: 街角那栋房子是我们的。

en: I had my car filled up at the service station at the corner.
zh: 我在拐角处的加油站把油加满了。

en: Not worth the remembered value.
zh: 不值得记挂。

en: I will get even with you some day. Remember it.
zh: 总有一天我会找你算账的。你给我记住了。

en: I will get even with you some day.
zh: 总有一天我会找你算账的。

en: Do you remember?
zh: 你还记得吗？

en: I can't promise anything, but I'll do my best.
zh: 我没法保证，但我会尽力的。

en: You want commitment, don't you?
zh: 你想要个承诺，对吧？

en: Be sure to drop in at my house.
zh: 记得来我家坐坐。

en: Please make sure.
zh: 请务必确认一下。

en: She certainly looks beautiful in a Japanese kimono.
zh: 她穿和服确实很漂亮。

en: She is rich, to be sure, but I don't think she's very smart.
zh: 她确实挺有钱的，但我觉得她不太聪明。

en: She is not beautiful, to be sure, but she is good-natured.
zh: 她虽然不漂亮，但心地挺好的。

en: No doubt she loves him, but she won't marry him.
zh: 她肯定爱他，但她不会嫁给他。

en: It is true she is a rare beauty.
zh: 她确实是个难得的大美女。

en: Indeed she is young and beautiful, but she is in delicate health.
zh: 她确实年轻漂亮，但身体比较虚。

en: She sings well, to be sure, but she can't act.
zh: 她歌唱得确实好，但不会演戏。

en: It is true that she is pretty, but she is selfish.
zh: 她确实长得好看，但挺自私的。

en: Certainly he is independent of him.
zh: 他确实不靠他。

en: You can certainly rely on him.
zh: 你绝对可以信任他。

en: He is a clever boy, to be sure.
zh: 这孩子确实挺聪明的。

en: Indeed he may be a little dull, but he is diligent.
zh: 他确实有点木讷，但挺勤快的。

en: No doubt he did his best, but he didn't succeed.
zh: 他肯定尽力了，但没成功。

en: He is not handsome, to be sure, but he is good-natured.
zh: 他虽然不帅，但人挺好的。

en: He is, without question, the best man for the job.
zh: 毫无疑问，他是这份工作的最佳人选。

en: I am positive that he is wrong.
zh: 我敢肯定他错了。

en: Certainly there are inequalities in level of education even within a generation, but there have been no visible inequities between machines and materials in recent years.
zh: 确实，即使是同一代人教育水平也存在不平等，但近年来机器和材料之间并没有明显的差距。

en: I did write to him.
zh: 我确实给他写过信。

en: It is hot, no doubt, but then the heat is dry.
zh: 确实挺热的，不过是那种干热。

en: A car is convenient, to be sure, but, after all, it will prove expensive.
zh: 买车确实方便，但说到底还是挺费钱的。

en: It is true that he is over seventy.
zh: 他确实已经七十多岁了。

en: I'm sure I've seen him before.
zh: 我肯定以前见过他。

en: I'm alive all right, but don't ask where or how.
zh: 我还活着，但别问我在哪儿或者怎么活下来的。

en: I did see him.
zh: 我确实见到他了。

en: I'm sure that's no fault of yours.
zh: 我确定那不是你的错。

en: It is true Wendy grew up at the seaside, but she isn't a good swimmer.
zh: 虽说温迪是在海边长大的，但她游泳并不好。

en: I am sure I met him somewhere, but I do not remember who he is.
zh: 我肯定在哪儿见过他，但我想不起来他是谁了。

en: I admit this may not be the best way of doing it.
zh: 我承认这可能不是最好的办法。

en: Indeed, some writers do not think the relation of brain to consciousness is a causal relation in the first place.
zh: 确实，有些作家根本不认为大脑和意识之间是因果关系。

en: Surely the most curious of sources consulted is Mankind Quarterly.
zh: 确实，引用的资料里最奇怪的就是《人类季刊》了。

en: There is one thing that is certain.
zh: 有一件事是可以肯定的。

en: He did not get any game.
zh: 他什么猎物也没打着。

en: The hunter cannot exist without the hunted.
zh: 没有猎物，也就没有猎人。

en: Only by prohibiting nuclear weapons altogether can we stop the arms race.
zh: 只有全面禁止核武器，我们才能停止军备竞赛。

en: Nuclear weapons are a threat to all humanity.
zh: 核武器对全人类都是一种威胁。

en: Nuclear weapons will bring about nothing but the ruin of mankind.
zh: 核武器只会导致人类毁灭。

en: Nuclear weapons may bring about the annihilation of man.
zh: 核武器可能会让人类灭绝。

en: Nuclear weapons are a threat to the race.
zh: 核武器是对人类种族的威胁。

en: Nuclear power plants are dangerous, not to mention nuclear weapons.
zh: 核电站都很危险了，更不用说核武器了。

en: We think nuclear weapons will destroy our earth.
zh: 我们认为核武器会毁了地球。

en: Nuclear war will bring life on this planet to an end.
zh: 核战争会让地球上的生命走向终结。

en: A nuclear war will bring about the destruction of mankind.
zh: 一场核战争会毁灭全人类。

en: Who can survive after a nuclear war?
zh: 核战争之后谁还能活下来？

en: Few people, if any, could survive a nuclear war.
zh: 即便有人能活下来，恐怕也只是极少数。

en: All humanity will suffer if a nuclear war breaks out.
zh: 如果爆发核战争，全人类都会遭殃。

en: Come off it!
zh: 得了吧！

en: The nuclear family makes better communication possible between parents and children.
zh: 核心家庭让父母和孩子之间的沟通更顺畅。

en: Let's get discount tickets.
zh: 咱们买打折票吧。

en: The expansion is aging.
zh: 扩张正在步入后期。

en: I'm going to make enlarged copies.
zh: 我去复印几张放大的。

en: Round-trip fares to each destination are as follows.
zh: 去往各地的往返票价如下。

en: The top favorites of each section were gathered together.
zh: 各组最受欢迎的人都被聚集在了一起。

en: Each room is equipped with large desks.
zh: 每个房间都配备了大书桌。

en: PTAs in various places are discussing school regulations.
zh: 各地的家长教师协会都在讨论校规。

en: Each party shall consist of not less than fifteen people.
zh: 每组不得少于十五人。

en: Each generation would have to rediscover for itself the truths of the past.
zh: 每一代人都必须亲自重新发现过去的真理。

en: Each person has his own way of doing things.
zh: 每个人都有自己的做事方式。

en: Each speaker was allotted five minutes.
zh: 每个发言者都有五分钟时间。

en: Each man's pay will be in proportion to his work.
zh: 每个人的薪水都将与其工作量成正比。

en: Each man's pay was in proportion to his work.
zh: 每个人的薪金都是与其工作量成正比的。

en: The more unique each person is, the more he contributes to the wisdom of others.
zh: 每个人越独特，对他人智慧的贡献就越大。

en: Each man must cast a vote.
zh: 每个人都必须投上一票。

en: The lack of harmony between colors makes this painting stand out.
zh: 色彩间的不和谐让这幅画脱颖而出。

en: It has been demonstrated in various researches that the private sector has little influence over policy making.
zh: 多项研究表明，私营部门对政策制定几乎没什么影响。

en: The different character typologies are represented schematically in figure one.
zh: 不同的性格类型在图一中以示意图形式呈现。

en: Go to your respective seats.
zh: 各就各位。

en: Each of us has to be careful when driving.
zh: 咱们开车时都得小心点。

en: Go to your posts.
zh: 回到各自的岗位上去。

en: Every nation has its peculiar character.
zh: 每个民族都有其独特的性格。

en: Each country has its own customs.
zh: 每个国家都有各自的习俗。

en: There is a limit of two pieces of luggage for each passenger.
zh: 每位乘客限带两件行李。

en: Each member has to pay a membership fee.
zh: 每个成员都得交会费。

en: Each member has to pay 10,000 yen a month.
zh: 每个成员每月得交一万日元。

en: Each robot is equipped with a talking machine.
zh: 每个机器人都配有语音装置。

en: He who wears armor falls with a big crash!
zh: 穿着盔甲的人摔起跤来，动静可是很大的！

en: Like water off a duck's back.
zh: 完全就是耳边风。

en: The street, lined with trees, provided a vista of the sea.
zh: 街道两旁绿树成荫，可以看到大海。

en: The streets are laid out quite well.
zh: 街道布局得挺不错的。

en: No one was to be seen in the street.
zh: 街上一个人影也见不到。

en: We had lunch at a roadside restaurant.
zh: 我们在路边的一家餐馆吃了午饭。

en: Houses were lined up alongside the highway.
zh: 房子沿着公路一字排开。

en: The road tends to the south at the next village.
zh: 路在下一个村子折向南边。

en: I walked about aimlessly on the street.
zh: 我在街上漫无目的地闲逛。

en: Give us a ride downtown.
zh: 载我们去市中心吧。

en: I want to see the streets.
zh: 我想看看这里的街道。

en: The town was defended by a large army.
zh: 这个镇子由一支大军守卫。

en: More people live in the northern part of the city.
zh: 更多的人住在城北。

en: Please give me a map of the town.
zh: 请给我一张镇上的地图。

en: Living in the town is quite different from living in the country.
zh: 住在镇上和住在乡下大不相同。

en: There's an old movie theater in town.
zh: 镇上有一家老电影院。

en: Let's have lunch downtown and take in a show.
zh: 咱们去市中心吃个午饭，顺便看场演出吧。

en: The town was flooded with strange foreign words.
zh: 镇上充斥着奇怪的外来词。

en: As a rule, she is an early riser.
zh: 一般来说，她起得很早。

en: I cannot get the lid off.
zh: 我打不开这个盖子。

en: Generally speaking, Japanese are hard workers.
zh: 总的来说，日本人工作很勤奋。

en: It may be said, as a rule, that the climate of Japan is mild.
zh: 基本上可以说，日本的气候挺温和的。

en: Generally speaking, the climate of Japan is mild.
zh: 一般来说，日本的气候比较温和。

en: As a rule we have much rain in June in Japan.
zh: 通常来说，日本六月的雨水挺多的。

en: As a rule, twins have a lot in common.
zh: 一般来说，双胞胎有很多共同点。

en: In general, people were against the consumption tax.
zh: 总的来说，人们当时是反对消费税的。

en: As a rule, man is inclined to be lazy.
zh: 通常情况下，人都有变懒的倾向。

en: Generally speaking, women are better linguists than men.
zh: 一般来说，女性比男性更有语言天赋。

en: Generally speaking girls are better linguists than boys.
zh: 一般来说，女孩比男孩更擅长语言。

en: As a rule, we have a lot of rain in fall.
zh: 通常来说，我们这儿秋天雨水很多。

en: Altogether, things are going well.
zh: 总的来说，一切进展得还算顺利。

en: As a rule, I prefer a comedy to a tragedy.
zh: 我通常比起悲剧更喜欢喜剧。

en: I like Chinese food in general.
zh: 总的来说，我挺喜欢中国菜的。

en: On the whole, I am in favor of your opinion.
zh: 总的来说，我赞同你的意见。

en: As a rule, our English teacher gives a lot of homework.
zh: 通常情况下，我们的英语老师会布置很多作业。

en: Generally speaking, what she says is right.
zh: 一般来说，她说的是对的。

en: Generally speaking, the climate here is mild.
zh: 一般来说，这儿的气候挺温和的。

en: In general the relation between parents and children is essentially based on teaching.
zh: 总的来说，父母和孩子的关系本质上是建立在教导之上的。

en: Generally speaking, women live longer than men.
zh: 一般来说，女性比男性更长寿。

en: On the whole, the country has a severe climate.
zh: 总的来说，那个国家的气候很恶劣。

en: Generally speaking, Americans are very fond of coffee.
zh: 一般来说，美国人非常喜欢喝咖啡。

en: Generally speaking, we Japanese are a little too timid in speaking foreign languages.
zh: 一般来说，我们日本人在说外语时有点太胆小了。

en: The weather in Florida is generally moderate.
zh: 佛罗里达的天气通常比较温和。

en: As a rule, hail falls in summer.
zh: 通常来说，冰雹是在夏天下的。

en: On the whole, the result was unsatisfactory.
zh: 总的来说，结果不太令人满意。

en: On the whole, the elite are not sensitive to criticism.
zh: 总的来说，精英阶层对批评并不敏感。

en: On the whole, my company is doing well now.
zh: 总的来说，我公司现在经营得挺好的。

en: As a rule, I prefer people who deal with matters of this kind directly with those involved.
zh: 通常来说，我更喜欢那种处理这类事情时能直接跟当事人沟通的人。

en: Generally the Americans are a kind people.
zh: 一般来说，美国人都挺友好的。

en: On the whole, I think your plan is a very good one.
zh: 总的来说，我觉得你的计划非常好。

en: As a rule, he arrives at the office at about nine-thirty in the morning.
zh: 他通常早上九点半左右到办公室。

en: On the whole, the older a man grows, the more conservative he becomes.
zh: 总的来说，人年纪越大就越保守。

en: On the whole, the Japanese are conservative.
zh: 总的来说，日本人挺保守的。

en: As a rule, Japanese people are not good at foreign languages.
zh: 通常来说，日本人不太擅长外语。

en: Generally speaking, men are stronger than women.
zh: 一般来说，男人比女人强壮。

en: Generally speaking, boys can run faster than girls.
zh: 一般来说，男孩比女孩跑得快。

en: As a rule, the game of life is worth playing.
zh: 总的来说，人生这场游戏还是值得一玩的。

en: As a rule, the more fundamental a new truth, the greater will be its practical possibilities.
zh: 通常来说，一个真理越是基础，它的实际应用潜力就越大。

en: By and large, women can bear pain better than men.
zh: 大体上说，女性比男性更耐疼。

en: By and large, reporters don't hesitate to intrude on one's privacy.
zh: 总的来说，记者在侵犯隐私这方面从不犹豫。

en: As a rule, the inhabitants of warm countries keep early hours.
zh: 通常来说，气候温暖地区的人们起居都很早。

en: In general, Susie is a nice student.
zh: 总的来说，苏西是个挺不错的学生。

en: By and large, Tom is an easygoing person in almost everything he does.
zh: 大体上说，汤姆做任何事基本上都挺随和的。

en: On the whole, Canada has a severe climate.
zh: 总的来说，加拿大的气候很恶劣。

en: If you shout from the top of a cliff, you can hear the echo of your voice.
zh: 如果你在悬崖顶上喊，能听到自己的回声。

en: There is a narrow path running along by the cliff.
zh: 沿着悬崖有一条很窄的小路。

en: Down went the bus over the cliff.
zh: 巴士从悬崖上栽了下去。

en: The man and his horse that fell off the cliff were soon rescued.
zh: 掉下悬崖的那个人和他的马很快就被救了上来。

en: Some medicine does us harm.
zh: 有些药对身体有害。

en: You must not read such books as will do you harm.
zh: 你不该看那些对你有害的书。

en: You must not read such a magazine, as it will do you harm.
zh: 你不该看这种杂志，对你没好处。

en: I cleared my throat, but no words came.
zh: 我清了清嗓子，但没说出话来。

en: Do you have any cough medicine?
zh: 你有止咳药吗？

en: You should buy some cough medicine and aspirin.
zh: 你该买点止咳药和阿司匹林。

en: Do you have any coughing?
zh: 你咳嗽吗？

en: Cover your mouth when you cough, sneeze, or yawn.
zh: 咳嗽、打喷嚏或者打哈欠的时候，要把嘴捂上。

en: External application only.
zh: 仅供外用。

en: The foreign minister attended the talks.
zh: 外交部长参加了会谈。

en: Outside advice may be necessary.
zh: 可能需要听听外界的建议。

en: External pressure grows ever more intense.
zh: 外部压力越来越大了。

en: Save it on the external hard drive.
zh: 存到外接硬盘里吧。

en: Can I sleep out?
zh: 我能在外面过夜吗？

en: The Foreign Minister said that war was inevitable.
zh: 外长说战争不可避免。

en: People shouldn't stare at foreigners.
zh: 别盯着外国人看。

en: Don't make fun of foreigners.
zh: 别取笑外国人。

en: As is often the case with foreigners, John dislikes nattou.
zh: 就像很多外国人一样，约翰也不喜欢纳豆。

en: It is difficult for foreigners to get used to Japanese food.
zh: 外国人很难适应日本菜。

en: See to it that the door is locked before you leave.
zh: 走之前记得锁门。

en: I don't feel like going out.
zh: 我不想出门。

en: I have to do my homework instead of going out.
zh: 我得做作业，不能出去玩。

en: Don't forget to polish your shoes before you go out!
zh: 出门前别忘了擦皮鞋！

en: Are you going to pull curfew on me?
zh: 你要给我定门禁吗？

en: It was careless of her to leave the door unlocked when she went out.
zh: 她出门竟然没锁门，真是太粗心了。

en: Comb your hair before you go out.
zh: 出门前梳梳头。

en: See to it that all the doors are locked before you go out.
zh: 出门前一定要确保所有的门都锁好了。

en: Make sure to turn off all the lights before going out.
zh: 出门前记得把灯都关了。

en: I would rather stay at home than go out.
zh: 我宁愿呆在家里也不想出门。

en: It is better to stay in than go out.
zh: 呆在家里比出门强。

en: I'd rather stay home than go out.
zh: 我更想在家呆着，不想出去。

en: I would rather stay home than go out.
zh: 我宁可在家呆着也不出去。

en: Didn't you go out?
zh: 你没出门吗？

en: People traveling abroad always have to get used to new food.
zh: 出国旅游总得适应当地的食物。

en: There are lots of benefits from travelling abroad.
zh: 出国旅游有很多好处。

en: We should not put restrictions on foreign trade.
zh: 我们不应该限制对外贸易。

en: Foreign products arrived on the market in large quantities.
zh: 大量外国商品涌入了市场。

en: If you engage in espionage for a foreign power, you are selling your country down the river.
zh: 如果你给外国当间谍，那你就是在卖国。

en: We should not use foreign workers as a buffer against Japan's economic slowdown.
zh: 我们不应该把外籍劳工当作日本经济放缓的缓冲。

en: The influx of foreign workers has caused a serious housing problem in this area.
zh: 外籍劳工的涌入让这一地区的住房问题变得很严重。

en: I don't have a prejudice against foreign workers.
zh: 我对外籍劳工没有偏见。

en: We give foreign tourists the privilege of tax exemption.
zh: 我们给外国游客免税待遇。

en: Foreign students demanded help from us.
zh: 留学生要求我们提供帮助。

en: It is difficult for foreign students to speak English well.
zh: 留学生想把英语说好挺难的。

en: Another tendency of many Japanese that bothers foreigners is to make statements that are too general and too broad by using or implying words like "all" and "every".
zh: 日本人还有一个让外国人烦的地方，就是说话太笼统，老爱用“全部”或者“每个”这类词。

en: Foreigners admire Mt. Fuji.
zh: 外国人都很崇拜富士山。

en: Foreigners complain that it is difficult to get to know Japanese people. To some extent this may be true.
zh: 外国人常抱怨说很难了解日本人，在某种程度上这可能是真的。

en: Only if a foreigner has read much English poetry can he understand Shakespeare.
zh: 外国人只有读过很多英国诗，才能读懂莎士比亚。

en: Foreigners in general don't need as many compliments as Japanese are required to give each other, and it is good to keep this in mind.
zh: 外国人通常不像日本人那样需要互相客套，记住这一点挺有好处的。

en: Don't make fun of foreigners' mistakes in Japanese.
zh: 别笑话外国人在说日语时犯的错误。

en: He will come with his wife, as is often the case with foreigners.
zh: 他会带他妻子一起来，外国人通常都这样。

en: A group of foreigners arrived in Edo, i.e. Tokyo.
zh: 一群外国人来到了江户，也就是现在的东京。

en: Being spoken to by a foreigner, I did not know what to do.
zh: 有个外国人跟我搭话，我当时有点不知所措。

en: It is interesting to make friends with a foreigner.
zh: 和外国人交朋友挺有意思的。

en: It is difficult for foreigners to master Japanese.
zh: 外国人想精通日语挺难的。

en: It is difficult for a foreigner to study Japanese.
zh: 外国人学日语挺不容易的。

en: It is difficult for foreigners to get used to Japanese meals.
zh: 外国人挺难适应日本菜的。

en: Foreign investors backed off because of regional political unrest.
zh: 因为当地政局不稳，外国投资者都撤了。

en: Speaking foreign languages is not easy.
zh: 说外语可不简单。

en: You'll find it your advantage to know a foreign language.
zh: 你会发现会门外语挺占优势的。

en: It is almost impossible to learn a foreign language in a short time.
zh: 想在短时间内学会一门外语几乎不可能。

en: The best way to learn a foreign language is to go to the country where it is spoken.
zh: 学外语最好的办法就是去那个国家。

en: To speak a foreign language well takes time.
zh: 要想把外语说好得花时间。

en: The best way to master a foreign language is to go to the country where it is spoken.
zh: 精通一门外语最好的办法就是去那个国家。

en: It is not easy to learn a foreign language.
zh: 学外语不容易。

en: It takes a great deal of practice to master a foreign language.
zh: 要想精通一门外语得练很多才行。

en: It is by no means easy to master a foreign language.
zh: 精通一门外语绝非易事。

en: You must have a lot of patience to learn foreign languages.
zh: 学外语得有足够的耐心。

en: Few people can speak a foreign language perfectly.
zh: 很少有人能把外语说得完美。

en: Learning a foreign language is difficult.
zh: 学外语挺难的。

en: What is the best way to learn a foreign language?
zh: 学外语最好的方法是什么？

en: It is often said that the best way to learn a foreign language is to go to the country where it is spoken.
zh: 大家都说学外语最好的办法就是去那个国家。

en: It's difficult to learn a foreign language.
zh: 学外语挺不容易的。

en: We should make good use of dictionaries when studying a foreign language.
zh: 学外语的时候得好好利用词典。

en: Learning a foreign language is fun.
zh: 学外语挺好玩的。

en: It takes years to master a foreign language.
zh: 想精通一门外语得花好几年。

en: If I want to master a foreign language, I must study as much as possible.
zh: 要想精通一门外语，我得尽可能多学。

en: You can't master a foreign language in a short time; you have to study it step by step.
zh: 你没法在短时间内精通外语，得一步步来。

en: A foreign language cannot be mastered in a year or so.
zh: 一年半载的可精通不了一门外语。

en: I will show you a new approach to foreign language learning.
zh: 我给你展示个学外语的新方法。

en: Mastering a foreign language calls for patience.
zh: 精通外语得有耐心。

en: Mastering a foreign language involves a lot of patience.
zh: 要想精通一门外语需要很大的耐心。

en: Regular attendance is important in a foreign language class.
zh: 上外语课不旷课很重要。

en: Are you interested in foreign languages?
zh: 你对外语感兴趣吗？

en: It's by no means easy to master a foreign language.
zh: 想精通一门外语一点儿也不容易。

en: It's difficult to feel at home in a foreign language.
zh: 说外语很难感觉像说母语那样自在。

en: Speaking of foreign languages, can you speak French?
zh: 说到外语，你会说法语吗？

en: Isn't it difficult to make yourself understood in a foreign language?
zh: 用外语让别人听懂你的意思挺难的吧？

en: It is so good to be able to speak a number of foreign languages.
zh: 能会好几门外语真是太棒了。

en: Some knowledge of foreign languages, of Spanish in particular, is essential.
zh: 懂点外语，特别是西班牙语，非常必要。

en: Traveling abroad is very interesting.
zh: 出国旅游挺有意思的。

en: The best way to know a foreign country is to go there yourself.
zh: 了解一个国家最好的办法就是亲自去看看。

en: The very idea of being sent abroad delighted them.
zh: 一想到要被派出国，他们就特别高兴。

en: The good way to know a foreign country is to go there.
zh: 了解一个国家的好办法就是去那儿。

en: It is not until you go abroad that you realize how small Japan is.
zh: 只有出了国，你才会发现日本有多小。

en: He had not been abroad for one month before he was taken ill.
zh: 他出国还不到一个月就病倒了。

en: You should avail yourself of the chance to go abroad.
zh: 你应该利用这次出国的机会。

en: Have you been abroad?
zh: 你出过国吗？

en: The number of people who go abroad has been increasing.
zh: 出国的人越来越多了。

en: He took his daughter with him whenever he went abroad.
zh: 他每次出国都带着女儿。

en: Visiting a foreign country must be expensive.
zh: 去外国旅游一定很贵吧。

en: Do people behave differently when they go abroad?
zh: 人们出国后表现会不一样吗？

en: Mary's dream of going abroad finally became a reality.
zh: 玛丽出国的梦想终于实现了。

en: I want to go abroad.
zh: 我想出国。

en: It's fun to learn about foreign cultures.
zh: 了解外国文化挺有意思的。

en: Do you have any foreign stamps?
zh: 你有外国邮票吗？

en: There are a number of shops selling foreign books and periodicals.
zh: 有好几家店卖外文书刊。

en: Keep in touch with what is happening in foreign countries.
zh: 多关注关注国外发生的事儿。

en: Do you have any imported beer?
zh: 有进口啤酒吗？

en: You need a passport to enter a foreign country.
zh: 去国外得有护照。

en: Don't you feel any inconvenience living abroad?
zh: 你在国外生活觉得有什么不方便吗？

en: Living abroad is the best way to learn a foreign language.
zh: 住在国外是学外语最好的办法。

en: You learn a lot about your own country if you live abroad.
zh: 出了国，你反而会对自己国家了解更多。

en: I'm thinking of going abroad.
zh: 我在考虑出国。

en: If I were to go abroad, I would go by boat.
zh: 要是出国的话，我想坐船去。

en: In a foreign country most of us go through culture shock.
zh: 在国外，大多数人都会经历文化冲击。

en: I haven't heard from my son who is overseas.
zh: 我还没收到我在国外的儿子的消息。

en: I couldn't make myself understood in a foreign country.
zh: 在国外，我没法跟人沟通。

en: No matter how busy he was while living abroad, he never failed to write home to his parents at least once a week.
zh: 他在国外的时候，不管多忙，每周起码都会给父母写封信。

en: It is important to try to get along with people from foreign countries.
zh: 试着跟外国人好好相处挺重要的。

en: We have to buy them from abroad.
zh: 我们得从国外买。

en: The foreign executives visited the manufacturing plant.
zh: 外方高管参观了生产工厂。

en: A group of foreign students visited Akira's high school.
zh: 一群外国学生去晃的高中参观了。

en: In foreign countries, especially in Western countries, students are encouraged to express and develop themselves as individuals.
zh: 在国外，尤其是西方国家，学校鼓励学生表达和发展个性。

en: Have you visited foreign countries, say America?
zh: 你去过国外吗？比如美国什么的？

en: Diplomatic dialogue helped put an end to the conflict.
zh: 外交对话帮助平息了冲突。

en: Diplomacy is to do and say the nastiest thing in the nicest way.
zh: 外交就是用最体面的方式说最狠的话。

en: An ambassador is an honest man sent to lie abroad for the good of his country.
zh: 大使就是一个为了国家利益，被派到国外去说谎的老实人。

en: Diplomats are allowed various privileges.
zh: 外交官享有各种特权。

en: I am no match for him in diplomatic shrewdness.
zh: 论外交上的精明，我比不过他。

en: You must not rely too much on appearance.
zh: 别太看重外表了。

en: Don't be deceived by appearances.
zh: 别被外表给骗了。

en: He deceives others with his appearance.
zh: 他用外貌迷惑别人。

en: Don't judge a man by his appearance.
zh: 人不可貌相。

en: Don't judge a person by his appearance.
zh: 别以貌取人。

en: Judge him by what he does, not by his appearance.
zh: 看他做了什么，别光看他长什么样。

en: We cannot separate the sheep from the goats by appearance.
zh: 光凭外表是分不出好坏的。

en: No matter how we try, it is impossible to distinguish good people from bad people by outward appearances.
zh: 不管怎么努力，光看外表是没法分辨好人坏人的。

en: Judging from her appearance, she seems to be very rich.
zh: 看她的样子，好像挺有钱的。

en: One cannot judge people only by their outward appearances.
zh: 评判一个人不能只看长相。

en: Judging from his appearance, he is ill.
zh: 看他的样子，像是生病了。

en: Judging from his appearance, he must be the conductor.
zh: 看他的样子，他一定是位指挥。

en: The air felt a little cold.
zh: 空气感觉有点冷。

en: Appearance is deceptive.
zh: 外表是会骗人的。

en: The exchange rates for foreign currency change daily.
zh: 外汇汇率每天都在变。

en: The surgeon persuaded me to undergo an organ transplant operation.
zh: 外科医生说服我做了器官移植手术。

en: The surgeon took out his patient's appendix.
zh: 外科医生切掉了病人的阑尾。

en: The surgeon persuaded him to undergo an organ transplant.
zh: 外科医生说服他做了器官移植。

en: The surgeon persuaded me to undergo an operation.
zh: 外科医生说服我动手术。

en: Please go to the Surgery Department.
zh: 请去外科。

en: Shine your shoes before going out.
zh: 出门前把鞋擦亮。

en: I felt a chill when I went out of the house.
zh: 我一出门就感到一阵凉意。

en: Once outside, I gave a deep sigh of relief.
zh: 一到外面，我就长舒了一口气。

en: You can't go out.
zh: 你不能出去。

en: I feel like going out.
zh: 我挺想出去转转的。

en: Get out, or you will be sorry.
zh: 给我出去，不然你会后悔的。

en: It seems warm outside.
zh: 外面看着挺暖和的。

en: It was piercingly cold outside.
zh: 外面冷得刺骨。

en: It was pitch black outside.
zh: 外面漆黑一片。

en: There is a strong wind blowing outside.
zh: 外面风刮得很大。

en: It is cold outdoors. Put on your coat.
zh: 外面冷，把外套穿上。

en: Come inside because it's cold outside.
zh: 外面冷，快进屋吧。

en: Since it's cold outside, you'd better put your overcoat on.
zh: 外面冷，你最好把大衣穿上。

en: You should put on a raincoat because it's cold outside.
zh: 外面冷，你应该穿上雨衣。

en: It is getting dark outdoors.
zh: 外面天快黑了。

en: It is getting dark outside.
zh: 外面天慢慢变黑了。

en: It is still light outside.
zh: 外面天还亮着呢。

en: It is dark outside.
zh: 外面天黑了。

en: It's very gray outside.
zh: 外面阴沉沉的。

en: It's raining buckets outside.
zh: 外面正下着瓢泼大雨。

en: It is very cold outside. You'll catch a cold without a coat.
zh: 外面很冷，不穿外套会感冒的。

en: It is getting lighter outside.
zh: 外面天亮起来了。

en: It's getting dark little by little outside.
zh: 外面天在一点一点变黑。

en: It's like summer outside.
zh: 外面跟夏天似的。

en: I feel a chill seeing the blizzard outside.
zh: 看着外面的暴风雪，我感到阵阵寒意。

en: I didn't feel like studying because the noise outside was getting on my nerves.
zh: 外面太吵了，吵得我根本没心思学习。

en: I have a spare key to my house hidden outside.
zh: 我在外面藏了一把备用钥匙。

en: Could we have a table outside?
zh: 我们可以坐外面吗？

en: Get out.
zh: 出去。

en: May I go out to play?
zh: 我可以出去玩吗？

en: No sooner had I gone out than it began to rain.
zh: 我刚一出门就开始下雨了。

en: I stepped outside and was bathed in the harsh direct sunlight.
zh: 我一出门就晒到了刺眼的阳光。

en: As soon as I went out, it began to rain.
zh: 我一出门就开始下雨了。

en: I shivered with cold when I went outside.
zh: 我一到外面就冷得发抖。

en: He would not go out.
zh: 他就是不肯出去。

en: Could you let him out?
zh: 你能放他出去吗？

en: He is playing outdoors.
zh: 他在外面玩呢。

en: A sudden loud noise broke in on my meditation.
zh: 突然的一声巨响打断了我的冥想。

en: I hear footsteps outside.
zh: 我听见外面有脚步声。

en: The cold north wind was roaring outside.
zh: 外面北风呼呼地刮着。

en: Please invite us out to dinner.
zh: 请我们出去吃顿饭吧。

en: The sky is getting light.
zh: 天快亮了。

en: I don't like to cook when it's hot outside.
zh: 天热的时候我不想做饭。

en: Don't stay indoors because it is cold outside.
zh: 别因为外面冷就总待在屋里。

en: I couldn't sleep well because it was noisy outside.
zh: 外面太吵了，我没睡好。

en: I don't like shellfish.
zh: 我不喜欢吃贝类。

en: I missed a step on the stairs and I'm afraid I sprained my ankle.
zh: 我下楼梯踩空了，恐怕是把脚崴了。

en: He called his father as he went up the stairs.
zh: 他上楼的时候喊了他爸爸。

en: Go up the stairs.
zh: 上楼去。

en: I'm out of breath after running up the stairs.
zh: 我跑上楼，累得直喘粗气。

en: Watch your step in going down the stairs.
zh: 下楼梯小心点。

en: I fell down the stairs and hit my back very hard.
zh: 我从楼梯上摔了下来，背撞得很疼。

en: The hierarchy of rank has long been fixed.
zh: 等级制度早已经固定了。

en: Please come downstairs.
zh: 请下楼。

en: Election returns were what we had expected.
zh: 选举结果跟我们预想的一样。

en: Grand opening sale.
zh: 开业大酬宾。

en: The settlers learned that the land in the valley was fertile.
zh: 定居者们发现山谷里的土地很肥沃。

en: The settlers embraced the Christian religion.
zh: 定居者们信奉了基督教。

en: Pioneer men and women had a hard life, and so did their children.
zh: 拓荒者的生活很艰苦，他们的孩子也一样。

en: The pioneers met with many dangers.
zh: 拓荒者们遇到了很多危险。

en: The colonists bartered with the natives for fur.
zh: 殖民者跟当地人以物易物换取皮毛。

en: The opening ceremony took place on schedule.
zh: 开幕式按计划举行了。

en: The opening of the country had a great influence on Japanese civilization.
zh: 对外开放对日本文明产生了巨大影响。

en: The opening ceremony took place yesterday.
zh: 开幕式是昨天举行的。

en: I plan to invite a lot of guests to the opening ceremony.
zh: 我打算请很多客人来参加开幕式。

en: The opening address alone lasted one hour.
zh: 光是开幕词就讲了一个小时。

en: The curtain rises at 7 p.m.
zh: 演出晚上七点开始。

en: No admittance during the performance.
zh: 演出期间禁止入内。

en: What time does the play begin?
zh: 戏什么时候开始？

en: I found the box empty.
zh: 我发现箱子是空的。

en: Keep your eyes closed until I tell you to open them.
zh: 我叫你睁眼之前先闭着眼。

en: Open up.
zh: 开门。

en: If you turn on me like that, I cannot talk any more.
zh: 你要是这样跟我翻脸，我就没法聊了。

en: You cannot make a crab walk straight.
zh: 你没法让螃蟹走直线。

en: I would like to excuse myself from receiving the Akutagawa Prize.
zh: 我想谢绝领取芥川奖。

en: Picture books will cultivate the minds of children.
zh: 绘本能陶冶孩子的心灵。

en: Paintings should not be exposed to direct sunlight.
zh: 画不能让阳光直射。

en: The first virtue of a painting is to be a feast for the eyes.
zh: 画的首要美德就是赏心悦目。

en: I draw for a hobby.
zh: 画画是我的爱好。

en: Drawing is a lot of fun; it helps me to relax.
zh: 画画很有意思，能让我放松。

en: Look at the picture.
zh: 看这张画。

en: How many pictures did you buy?
zh: 你买了几张画？

en: The picture looks better at a distance.
zh: 这画远看更好看。

en: Is the picture straight?
zh: 这画挂正了吗？

en: I'm going to France to study painting.
zh: 我要去法国学画画。

en: Everybody in the picture is smiling happily.
zh: 照片里的每个人都笑得很开心。

en: The girl in the picture is wearing a crown not of gold but of flowers.
zh: 画里的女孩戴的不是金冠而是花冠。

en: You must not touch the paintings.
zh: 千万别碰这些画。

en: Never confuse art with life.
zh: 永远不要把艺术和生活混为一谈。

en: The picture is hung crooked.
zh: 这画挂歪了。

en: The picture hangs over the table.
zh: 桌子上方挂着那幅画。

en: Strange to say, all the lights in the house were on, though no one was at home.
zh: 说来也怪，虽然家里没人，但灯都亮着。

en: May I begin by thanking every one for your warm welcome?
zh: 首先，我想感谢大家的热烈欢迎。

en: May I have your attention, please?
zh: 请大家留意一下。

en: Excuse us for the inconvenience.
zh: 给您带来不便，敬请谅解。

en: I esteem it an honor to address this audience.
zh: 很荣幸能在这里对大家演讲。

en: May you all be happy.
zh: 祝大家幸福。

en: I don't have the slightest idea.
zh: 我一点儿都不知道。

en: All were satisfied.
zh: 大家都挺满意的。

en: Everyone says that he's a good man.
zh: 大家都说他是个好人。

en: Everybody was disguised, so I couldn't tell who was who.
zh: 大家都乔装打扮了，我认不出谁是谁。

en: They regarded him as the best doctor in town.
zh: 他们认为他是镇上最好的医生。

en: Everybody seems to pay attention to what he says.
zh: 好像大家都很在意他说的话。

en: Everybody wished he had been elected governor.
zh: 大家本来都希望他能当上州长。

en: Everyone opposed it, but they got married all the same.
zh: 尽管大家都反对，他们还是结婚了。

en: A cellar was dug on top of the hill and they slowly moved the house from the road to the hill.
zh: 他们在山顶上挖了个地窖，然后慢慢把房子从路边搬到了山上。

en: Everybody came to the class on time.
zh: 大家都准时来上课了。

en: The project was successful in the sense that it drew the attention of everyone.
zh: 那个项目挺成功的，因为大家都关注到了。

en: Is there enough food to go around?
zh: 吃的够分吗？

en: I will see you, each in your turn.
zh: 我会按顺序一个个见你们。

en: Let's extend our heartiest welcome to Miyake-san.
zh: 让我们热烈欢迎三宅先生。

en: Each is good in its degree.
zh: 各有各的好处。

en: Everybody was interested in the story.
zh: 大家都对这个故事很感兴趣。

en: Make sure that all of you arrive at nine.
zh: 你们大家九点前一定要到。

en: You are making history.
zh: 你们正在创造历史。

en: You don't have to trouble yourselves.
zh: 你们不用这么费事。

en: You can enter the library freely.
zh: 你们可以随便进图书馆。

en: How is everyone?
zh: 大家都还好吗？

en: Are you creating for us a future world where there is a greater danger of skin cancer, weakened bodies, less food and fewer plants and animals?
zh: 难道你们是在给我们创造一个皮肤癌风险更高、体质变差、食物减少、动植物也变少的未来世界吗？

en: With kind regards to you all.
zh: 祝大家一切都好。

en: Ladies and gentlemen, please allow me to say a few words of welcome.
zh: 女士们先生们，请允许我说几句欢迎的话。

en: I will miss you all.
zh: 我会想念大家的。

en: I'll never forget having a good time with you all.
zh: 我永远不会忘记和大家在一起的快乐时光。

en: Ladies and gentlemen, please come this way.
zh: 女士们先生们，请往这边走。

en: Make yourselves comfortable.
zh: 别客气，随便坐。

en: Please be quiet, everybody.
zh: 大家请安静。

en: I hope you are all well.
zh: 希望你们都好。

en: All aboard!
zh: 大家请上车！

en: Good morning, everybody.
zh: 大家早！

en: Be silent in the library, boys.
zh: 孩子们，在图书馆要保持安静。

en: Ladies and gentlemen, I would like you to listen to my opinion.
zh: 女士们先生们，我想请大家听听我的看法。

en: All right, everyone, let's not stand on ceremony tonight. Cheers!
zh: 好了，大家今晚别太拘束。干杯！

en: Look at the blackboard, everyone.
zh: 大家看黑板。

en: Good morning, everyone.
zh: 大家好。

en: My best wishes to you and yours.
zh: 祝你和你全家一切顺心。

en: Speak clearly so that everyone may hear you.
zh: 说清楚点，让大家都能听见。

en: Everybody took a hostile attitude toward illegal aliens.
zh: 大家都对非法移民很不友好。

en: Everyone regarded him as a great singer.
zh: 大家都觉得他是个很棒的歌手。

en: Everybody laughed.
zh: 大家都笑了。

en: Everybody looks up to him.
zh: 大家都挺尊敬他的。

en: Everybody laughed at me.
zh: 大家都笑话我。

en: He got angry because he thought that everyone was trying to make a fool of him.
zh: 他生气是因为他觉得大家都在耍他。

en: Everyone looked on me as a leader.
zh: 大家都把我当成领头的。

en: I was happy to find that they agreed to my plan.
zh: 看到大家都同意我的计划，我很高兴。

en: Everybody blames me for my careless mistake.
zh: 大家都怪我粗心大意犯了错。

en: We went to the theater early, so we could be sure that everyone could get a seat.
zh: 我们早早去了剧院，好让大家都有座儿。

en: All of you are familiar with the truth of the story.
zh: 你们大家都知道这个故事的真相。

en: They all looked up to him as their leader.
zh: 他们都把他当成领头的。

en: This meeting is a waste of time. Everybody is just talking in vague theoretical terms.
zh: 这会简直是浪费时间，大家都在那儿空谈理论。

en: I broke your ashtray.
zh: 我把你的烟灰缸弄坏了。

en: I need an ashtray.
zh: 我需要个烟灰缸。

en: Put the ashtray within eyes reach.
zh: 把烟灰缸放在一眼就能看到的地方。

en: Throw a sprat to catch a whale.
zh: 舍小鱼钓大鱼。

en: Has a change in ocean currents occurred?
zh: 洋流发生变化了吗？

en: Mountains in the ocean and even whole ranges are still being discovered, and most of them have not yet been explored in detail.
zh: 海底的山脉甚至整条山系还在不断被发现，而且大部分还没被详细勘察过。

en: Voyages of exploration were the earliest in the history of studying the ocean.
zh: 在海洋研究的历史上，航海探索是最早的形式。

en: If we are to judge the future of ocean study by its past, we can surely look forward to many exciting discoveries.
zh: 如果根据过去来预测海洋研究的未来，我们肯定能期待很多令人兴奋的新发现。

en: Driving along the coast is wonderful.
zh: 沿着海岸线开车感觉太棒了。

en: The seaside is an ideal spot for the children to play.
zh: 海边是孩子们玩耍的理想地点。

en: The air by the sea is pure and healthy.
zh: 海边的空气很清新，对健康很有好处。

en: I am taking a holiday at the beach.
zh: 我正在海边度假。

en: Mr Kaifu is used to making speeches in public.
zh: 海部先生已经习惯在公开场合演讲了。

en: Low-lying lands will flood. This means that people will be left homeless and their crops will be destroyed by the salt water.
zh: 低洼地带会被淹没，这意味着人们会无家可归，庄稼也会被海水毁掉。

en: We want to explore an underwater oil field.
zh: 我们想勘探一下海底油田。

en: A submarine cable was laid between the two countries.
zh: 这两个国家之间铺设了海底电缆。

en: The pirates had no choice but to surrender.
zh: 海盗们走投无路，只好投降。

en: The pirates buried their treasure in the ground.
zh: 海盗把他们的财宝埋在地下了。

en: Larger pirates often preyed on unarmed merchant ships.
zh: 规模较大的海盗经常掠夺没有武装的商船。

en: Let's make believe that we're pirates.
zh: 咱们假装自己是海盗吧。

en: The pirates sailed the seven seas.
zh: 海盗们在七大洋上航行。

en: This is the first time I've had seaweed.
zh: 这是我第一次吃海藻。

en: A sailor frequently has no time to get his sea legs after leaving port before a battle starts.
zh: 水手出港后，往往还没来得及适应海上颠簸，战斗就开始了。

en: The seawater stings my cut.
zh: 海水刺得我伤口疼。

en: He met his friend while bathing in the sea.
zh: 他在海里游泳的时候碰到了他的朋友。

en: There was a violent storm at sea.
zh: 海上刮起了猛烈的风暴。

en: Kaishuu made nothing of hardship.
zh: 海舟完全不把吃苦当回事。

en: It seems the navy jets had a major screw-up in navigation and they bombed their own troops by mistake.
zh: 看来海军战机的导航出了大差错，误炸了自家人。

en: A short stroll along the beach gave me a good appetite for breakfast.
zh: 在海滩上散散步让我早饭胃口大开。

en: What do you say to taking a walk by the seaside?
zh: 去海边走走怎么样？

en: There is no reason to wear a suit to the beach.
zh: 没必要穿着西装去海滩。

en: Which way is the beach?
zh: 海滩往哪边走？

en: Seaside resorts, such as Newport, are very crowded in summer.
zh: 像纽波特这样的海滨度假胜地，夏天人特别多。

en: They went to the beach.
zh: 他们去海滩了。

en: There were few people on the beach.
zh: 海滩上没几个人。

en: Paul's family spends the summer at the coast every year.
zh: 保罗一家每年夏天都在海边过。

en: We'll have a barbecue at the beach.
zh: 我们要在海滩上搞烧烤。

en: I saw a fishing boat about a mile off the shore.
zh: 我看到离岸边大概一英里的地方有一条渔船。

en: You will benefit by a trip abroad.
zh: 出国旅行一趟对你有好处。

en: Would you like to travel abroad?
zh: 你想出国旅游吗？

en: Traveling abroad is one of my favorite things.
zh: 出国旅游是我最喜欢的事情之一。

en: Traveling abroad is now more popular.
zh: 现在出国旅游越来越普遍了。

en: I had a chance to travel abroad.
zh: 我曾有机会出国旅游。

en: I've been invited on a trip abroad, but I don't want to go.
zh: 有人邀请我出国旅游，但我不想去。

en: Traveling abroad is out of the question.
zh: 出国旅游是不可能的。

en: Unfair tariffs are imposed on foreign products.
zh: 外国产品被征收了不公平的关税。

en: Canada is a good place to go if it's your first experience living abroad.
zh: 如果是第一次在国外生活，加拿大是个好去处。

en: Overseas food exports are one of the mainstays of agribusiness.
zh: 海外食品出口是农业综合企业的主要支柱之一。

en: It's going to be six dollars because it's international.
zh: 因为是国际的，所以要六美金。

en: When you travel abroad, you usually need a passport.
zh: 出国旅游通常需要护照。

en: The number of students going abroad to study is increasing each year.
zh: 出国留学的学生人数每年都在增加。

en: More and more couples go on honeymoon trips abroad.
zh: 越来越多的夫妻去国外度蜜月。

en: The number of Japanese going overseas has been increasing year by year.
zh: 出国的日本人一年比一年多。

en: The number of students going abroad is on the increase.
zh: 出国留学的学生人数在不断增长。
